meanings.sent1: Cheshire is known for its beautiful countryside.
meanings.sent2: I visited Cheshire last summer and enjoyed the peaceful villages.
meanings.sent3: Why did the farmer bring his cows to Cheshire? To graze on the lush green fields!
meanings.sent4: The rolling hills of Cheshire are like a patchwork quilt from above.
meanings.sent5: The quaint cottages in Cheshire look like they are from a storybook.

meanings.sent1: I love to pair Cheshire with crackers for a tasty snack.
meanings.sent2: The deli had a special on Cheshire cheese, so I bought some to try.
meanings.sent3: Why did the mouse invite the Cheshire to the party? For a cheesy good time!
meanings.sent4: The sharp flavor of Cheshire cheese woke up my taste buds.
meanings.sent5: The creamy texture of Cheshire cheese melts in your mouth.

meanings.definition: A cat in Lewis Carroll's 'Alice's Adventures in Wonderland.'
meanings.sent1: The Cheshire in the book can disappear and reappear at will.
meanings.sent2: Alice was surprised by the mischievous grin of the Cheshire.
meanings.sent3: Why did the Cheshire wear a top hat? To look purr-fectly dapper!
meanings.sent4: The Cheshire's mysterious smile lingered in Alice's memory.
meanings.sent5: The Cheshire's antics added a touch of whimsy to the story.
